Description: Yellow painted pottery shabti with a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a summarily modelled face and crossed arms in relief holding two black relief hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs(very worn); the back of the foot is damaged.
Condition: poor - paint worn, damage to back of foot
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
